page.name: Identify goals learners have already accomplished
page.content:
Everyone has accomplished some goals in their life. You can help all learners, but especially adults with learning differences feel more comfortable setting goals by identifying goals they have already accomplished. Doing this can reduce barriers and inequities some learners have in prior knowledge that is critical to setting goals. However, there are also barriers for learners who have the necessary prior knowledge but might not know it is relevant. Those barriers can be reduced when options are available that supply or activate relevant prior knowledge, or link to the pre-requisite information elsewhere.

Try It Yourself: Use Know-Want-Learn (KWL) methods to reflect on learning goals
